name: Tomato-Rice Soup
description: Many vegan dishes (like fruit salad and peanut butter and jelly) are already beloved, but the problem faced by many of us is in imagining less-traditional dishes that are interesting and not challenging. Here are some more creative options to try.
recipeCategory: dinner, lunch, one pot, soups and stews
keywords: appetizer, main course, side dish, gluten-free, vegan, vegetarian, rice, tomato

recipeInstructions.text: Cook a few cloves of chopped garlic with chopped onion, celery, parsley and carrot in abundant olive oil until the onion is translucent.
Add .5 cup white or brown rice and cook, stirring, until fragrant, then add a bit of tomato paste; stir
Add 4 cups vegetable stock or water and 2 cups of chopped fresh or canned tomatoes; bring to a boil and simmer until the rice is half-tender, about 10 minutes for white rice, 25 for brown.
Add a cup of chopped collard greens and a little red wine and cook until the greens are tender, just a few minutes. Serve.
